revised_title: Observations on the Effects of a Storm on Sea Water and Its Impact on Windows and the Environment
tldr: The author describes the effects of a storm on sea water and its impact on windows and the environment. He observes that sea water particles can be carried far inland during a storm and can cause damage to windows and other structures. Using a microscope, he examines the salt particles in the water and concludes that they can be beneficial to the soil, potentially increasing its fertility.
